meanings.definition: The state or quality of being feeble or weak.
meanings.sent1: Her feebleness made it hard for her to lift even the lightest objects.
meanings.sent2: The old man's feebleness was evident as he struggled to walk up the stairs.
meanings.sent3: Despite her feebleness, she tried to carry the groceries into the house.
meanings.sent4: The feebleness of the bridge was evident as it creaked under the weight of the truck.
meanings.sent5: The feebleness of the kitten's meow touched everyone's heart.

meanings.sent1: The feebleness of the plant was evident in its wilting leaves.
meanings.sent2: His feebleness prevented him from participating in the sports activities.
meanings.sent3: The feebleness of the battery caused the toy car to move slowly.
meanings.sent4: The feebleness of the wind made the leaves barely rustle.
meanings.sent5: The feebleness of the light bulb's glow indicated it needed to be replaced.

meanings.sent1: The feebleness of the thread caused it to break easily.
meanings.sent2: The feebleness of the glass made it shatter upon impact.
meanings.sent3: The feebleness of the ice cream cone led to a messy situation.
meanings.sent4: The feebleness of the rope was evident as it snapped under pressure.
meanings.sent5: The feebleness of the flower petals made them prone to falling off.
